data.title: Small inside, big flavors
data.text:
Karas is a smallish place which fills up quickly.  There's a reason for that, the food is good.  I prefer it for breakfast, and one amazing one is the omelette with gyro meat it in.  OMG, it's SO good.  We've done lunches here too, and they've never let us down.

I don't know how the cooks can operate in that tiny area they work in, but somehow they pull it off.  It's not fancy, but it's good, and that's what you really need.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: The best breakfast and lunch around. Been coming here for 20 plus years. Never disappointed!!! Family atmosphere come see big Lazarus behind the grill and the rest of the family to get treated like family!

data.title: Best Gyro's in town
data.text: What's not to like about this mom and pop place.  A tiny (small is too big) place with not much seating.  I always call in for carry out to get my "fix".  A gyro's sandwich.  You get 1 large piece of flat bread, that is LOADED with gyro's....Nothing fancy just a great sandwich.  I wish I could tell you more about the other food, but, I can't.  I've been going there for many years and never got anything else but the gyro's.

data.title: Great food, great location
data.text: very good food, fast and friendly service, great location. Lots of places to eat in St. Clair Shores and not all have friendly staff, great food or good prices

data.title: Breakfast Specials, Greek salad, and yeros are yummy.
data.text: Small little restaurant.  Quick service most of the time.  Friendly people.  Sometimes a little on the greasier side.  Good fries & Patty Melts & Yero Melt.

data.title: Feels like family
data.text: This is a no nonsense restaurant.  The breakfasts are extremely good and very cheap.  I usually get the special or the gyros and eggs with the sauce on the side.  I have been coming to this restaurant for over 25 years.  The owners are friendly, the waitresses are nice.  No frills, just good food.

data.title: A local favorite
data.text:
I've lived in St. Clair Shores and continue to visit on a regular basis and yet I had not previously noticed Karas Family Restaurant until I went to look for it.  After seeing reviews mentioning great breakfasts and Greek food, I decided to try the place.  Serving St. Clair Shores for over 25 years, the small diner was doing brisk business on Saturday, so obviously a local crowd knows exactly where they are.  Karas Family Restaurant is located on the east side of Harper, between Erben and Yale, just south of a vehicle glass replacement center.  

The place is small with booth and counter seating.  The kitchen area is compact and it is rather amazing to see three cooks, kitchen help and wait staff moving deftly through the small space with no mishaps.  The staff is friendly.  The service is prompt and accommodating.  In such a small diner, this suggests the Karas Family Restaurant waitresses are used to managing a full house on a regular basis and happily seem to be enjoying this.  They work together well.   

Breakfast is offered all day and the omelet selection is interesting.  I tried a small Greek salad with grilled pita and a fried egg sandwich.  The salad is served with a bottle of Greek dressing so you can add it as you like.  The pita and the sandwich were tasty.  

This is a family operation.  Owned by Lazaros Karavidas and run predominantly by his family, Mom was in the back while her friendly son was at the grill.  Some lovely artwork, available for sale, decorates the walls.  The cooking area is wonderfully kitschy, festooned with Greek mementos—the kind of décor that gives a diner its unique color.   Karas Family Restaurant has a vintage diner look that the regulars obviously enjoy.  The prices are reasonable and the food is good.  The hours are 7am to 4pm.  I'd like to return to try one of the omelets.

data.title: Don't miss this
data.text: Easy to drive past because it is so small.  But do yourself a favor and put it in the gps.   Gyros are the best anywhere.   You feel like a part of a big family.  Fresh food that tastes awesome.

data.title: Fun & Fabulous Diner
data.text:
Family who live in St. Clair Shores took us to breakfast at Karas and we didn't know what to expect when we walked into the tiny diner. But we were met with shouts of hello from the chefs in the open kitchen and the entire restaurant was a-buzz with friendly chatter. The staff is all related and makes you feel right at home.

I can only speak of the breakfast experience.

The menu include both Greek and American dishes. Frankly, I was shocked at the price. My two large buttermilk wheatcakes with three strips of bacon was only $3.95 (5/15) and they were light and fluffy. Our granddaughter's pancakes were shaped like Micky Mouse. If you order a breakfast that comes with toast, consider ordering pita instead for a delicious touch. My husband's eggs were poached perfectly. And everything came up hot and fast.

It's fun to watch the fellows at work in the open kitchen. As they cook, they chat and tease with guests. They all even came over to peer our newborn grandchild. And working behind the scene is their 90 year old mother, peeling potatoes, busing tables and coming out to make sure everyone is happy.

I almost hate to recommend this tiny diner because I'd hate to find that next time I can't get a seat! But it really is a fun spot for a casual, delicious meal.

data.title: Best breakfast in the shores!
data.text: This place has been around for as long as I can remember. They have some of the best breakfast you will find in the shores. Highly recommend!

data.title: Best breakfast and Greek in St. Clair Shores
data.text: Karas has the best breakfast and for a great price. Ask for the breakfast special, if your in for breakfast.  They have excellent Greek food. They have been there for years and hopefully for many years to come. The owners treat every customer like family. If there is a line, wait because it is worth it.
